questions.question_text: When configuring stages in Flow Designer, what are some of the options that can be done? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D are correct according to 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/administer/flow-designer/concept/flow-designer-stages.html
A,D are correct.

Selected Answer: AD
ITSM Implementation (Tokyo) ebook p176
A and D are correct

Correct Answer is AD
When configuring stages in Flow Designer, you can: • Create any number of stages. • Change stage labels and names. • Set the estimated duration for a stage. • Import a copy of a pre-defined stage set from the Stage Sets table. Any changes made to the copy do not affect the original stage set record. ITSM Implementation book Page ( 176 )

Selected Answer: AD
A. Stage labels and names can be changed
D. Estimated durations can be set

When configuring stages in Flow Designer, you can change the name or label of the stages, and also set the estimated duration for each stage. This helps in tracking how much time is taken for each stage in the flow. However, Flow Designer is not directly related to the Requested Item states or SLAs.

Selected Answer: AD

Selected Answer: AC
These two points highlight the flexible relationship between service catalogs and catalog items. A catalog item can indeed be linked to multiple service catalogs, and each service catalog can contain various catalog items, providing a structured way to manage and offer services.

Selected Answer: AC
Yes
correct

Correct

choices.C: Service catalogs may contain multiple catalog items
choices.A: A catalog item can be associated with one or more service catalogs
choices.D: A catalog item can only be associated with one service catalog
choices.B: Access to catalog items is determined by the service catalog's assigned user criteria

questions.question_text: How are Service Catalogs and Catalog Items related? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The catalog_admin role in ServiceNow has the ability to modify the cart layout, as well as manage and configure various aspects of the Service Catalog.

Selected Answer: C
